Table.Translation: There's only one Dot here. If your Dot isn't ready to breed and be released, continue growing them by completing desires and exploring the world!
Referral code is invalid. Try a different one.
Looks like another Peridot player already exists for that login. Want to continue with that player or go back?
You haven't discovered this Archetype yet! How mysterious! Raise more Dots, and maybe you'll uncover it.
Friends will see your Keeper name, your level, your current Peridot, and your current Peridot's name.
Take this Nest and check out the map now that {creatureName} can breed.
Dots only hang out at Habitats for a limited time or until a Dot breeds with them.
The map is where you can see all the Habitats in your area. Tap one of the markers to see Wild Dots and Dots other players have released.
Look at that! {creatureName} has become an adult!
Are you sure? Adventure Sync offers a lot of rewards!
Receive in game rewards while getting your fitness on! This feature will collect location data, even when the app is closed or not in use.
Tracks distance and location while the app is closed or not in use
Nancy's Saga, Chapter 1  A Dot with a big wish had to go on a big adventure...
Nancy's Saga, Chapter 1  There was a Dot who had a wish to hold all the wisdom in the world. They would need to travel far to get it, and shapeshift to travel far!
Nancy's Saga, Chapter 1  There once was a Dot who desired all the wisdom in the world. With ancient shapeshifting powers, they grew many legs to travel the world with!
{creatureName} raised hell with a rag-tag group of Peridots at {poiName} whilst you were away! They made sure everything was back in order before you got back though.
{creatureName} found some cool plants while you were away, but they weren't sure if they were poisonous. So naturally they ate a few of them! So far, so good.

We have detected activity on your account that indicates you are using modified client software or unauthorized third-party software in violation of our Terms of Service.

You may experience degraded gameplay for approximately 7 days.

We strongly encourage you to stop this activity. Any further transgressions will result in an account suspension.
I want the gold. Give me the gold. This archetype has gold colors and a metallic look.
What an aerodynamic design! This archetype has gold colors, a banana-y horn, no plumage, no horn, and a blotchy pattern.
This archetype has brown and yellow colors, stripes, and no tail.
This archetype has green colors, a head plume in a bright color, a pattern, and spikey plumes.
This one looks like a galaxy. This archetype has celestial colors, a starry look, and a starry pattern.
Purrrrrr. This archetype has a cheetah pattern, a waxy look, yellow colors, and a long, thin tail.
It looks like a tropical fish! This archetype has bright orange-y colors and a tropical pattern.
Cute enough to eat! This archetype has pastel colors, fur, and a chonky body.
MoooOOOO. This archetype has black and white colors, a cow pattern, and long horns.
Glitter, glitter everywhere. This archetype has glitter, glitter, and glitter.
The everyday fool. This archetype has royal colors, a diamond face, stripes, and a collar.
Some might say it looks like broken pottery. This archetype has a cracked pattern, a waxy look with metallic cracks, and muted colors.
Wow, very shiny. This archetype has a metallic look.
This archetype has brown colors, small ears, a monkey face, and a small tail.
This archetype has brown colors, small ears, a monkey face, and a small tail.
This archetype has pastel colors, antennae-like horns, is furry, and has plumes that look like wings.
{creatureName} and their banana-y goodness found a Banana Nest (x1) at a Habitat. They brought it back to you to create an army of Banana Peridots... or you can just send it to a friend.
Do you think {creatureName} went all the way to the Himalayas to get this Yeti Nest (x1)? Guess you'll just have to ask them.
{creatureName} wants the gold. They brought you back a 24 Karat Nest (x1).
{creatureName} brought you back a Clownfish Nest (x1). Use it to breed another Clownfish Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} is sweet! They brought you back a Cotton Candy Nest (x1).
{creatureName} is a joker. They brought you back a Jester Nest (x1).
{creatureName} brought you a Glitter Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Glitter Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Psychedelic Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Psychedelic Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Cow Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Cow Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Cactus Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Cactus Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Mosaic Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Mosaic Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} went all the way to the stars to get you this Celestial Nest (x1). Just kidding, they just went to the nearest Habitat.
{creatureName} brought you a Toxic Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Toxic Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Radish Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Radish Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Bee Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Bee Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Moth Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Moth Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Zebra Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Zebra Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a Monkey Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Monkey Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} and their banana-y goodness found a Banana Nest (x1) at a Habitat. They brought it back to you to create an army of Banana Peridots... or you can send it to a friend.
{creatureName} brought you back a Kintsugi Nest (x1)! Use it to breed another Kintsugi, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} brought you a very shiny Metallic Nest (x1) from a Habitat. Use it to breed another Metallic Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} got tired of peacocking so they brought you back a Peacock Nest (x1) from a Habitat.
{creatureName} hopped around and found you this Rabbit Nest (x1). You know how Rabbits are... always making more Rabbits.
{creatureName} brought you back a Ram Nest (x1). Use it to breed another Ram Archetype, or share it with a friend.
{creatureName} is a special Unicorn (x1). They want to make more special Unicorns, so they brought you a Unicorn Nest.
Such beautiful plumes! This archetype has bright blue colors, a big, beautiful tail, and no horns.
Woah. This archetype has an animated pattern, crazy colors, a melting face, and lots of plumage.
They say this one loves to breed. This archetype has tall ears and no tail.
This archetype has purple colors and grassy plumes.
Maaah. This archetype has curled horns, short ears, and a short tail.
This archetype has toxic colors and a dark face.
Majestic! This archetype has pastel colors, a glittery look, a single horn, and a long, flowing tail.
The myth! The legend! This archetype has devil horns, a chonky body, no tail, short ears, fur, and white and blue colors.
This archetype has black and white colors, a mane, stripes, and a small tail.

See if you can breed all the Peridot Archetypes! Each one has its own attributes and rarity, and will bring back Nests associated with that Archetype through Journeys. Breed new Archetypes by using Nests found at Habitats!
To attempt to breed you need to use a Nest!
Uh oh! Looks like authorization was revoked:
Track your previous Peridots here after breeding a new one.
Sorry! Guest login is currently disabled. Please try again later.
Making sense of the world (may take a bit)
What an interesting egg! Give it a few taps.
You must allow location sharing to play.

Allow Peridot to use your location information. 
Peridot is a real-world, location based AR game that requires some permissions and your location to play.
Which Peridot looks interesting to you?
{creatureName} is all grown up! You can use a Nest to attempt to breed them with another Dot.

Upgrade required. Please visit AppCenter.
 Current version: {buildVersion}
Caled's Saga, Chapter 1  A magic stone appeared, burning bright through the trees.
Caled's Saga, Chapter 1  A magic gemstone appeared out of nowhere in the middle of a forest. Its glow could be seen for miles.
Caled's Saga, Chapter 1  One day, a magic gem stone encased in stone appeared in the middle of a forest. Its glow pierced through the stone, into the heart of the forest.
{creatureName} watched the leaves drift slowly through the breeze around {poiName} while you were gone!
{creatureName} went to a quiet spot to meditate while you were away. They've never felt more zen!
Huma's Saga, Chapter 1  High in the sky, a Dot used their position for good.
Huma's Saga, Chapter 1  A Dot floating through the sky saw a man down below who needed help!
Huma's Saga, Chapter 1  There was once a cautious but kind Dot circled the skies looking for people to help. One day, they spied a poor, dishevelled human in distress.
{creatureName} found some cool plants while you were away, but they weren't sure if they were poisonous. So naturally they left them alone!
While you were away some humans came up to {creatureName}. They weren't sure what to make of them, so they thought they'd check with you first.
Momo's Saga, Chapter 1  A curious peach-shaped egg, floated.
Momo's Saga, Chapter 1  A curious peach-shaped egg arrived on the banks of a river. Inside, a downright peachy Kintsugi was about to hatch!
Momo's Saga, Chapter 1  A fabled peach egg arrived on the banks of a river. Other creatures tapped at it until golden cracks split: the fabled Kintsugi Momo was born!
{creatureName} went out and befriended some humans at {poiName} while you were gone. They couldn't wait for you to return!
While you were gone, {creatureName} got carried away cloud gazing. Either they were hungry, or a lot of clouds looked Prickly Beet-shaped!
Claim your Dotnip for the day
Woah! {creatureName} is now an adult and can breed with compatible Peridots at Habitats!
{creatureName} is growing! They grow up so fast.
{creatureName} became a teen! One day they'll want to be released at a Habitat.
What do you want to call yourself?
You already have that Keeper name
Complete their desires, get experience, and grow them to adulthood in a couple of days.
Completing desires gives your Peridot lots of experience.
Sang's Saga, Chapter 1  There was a Dot who was small but mighty!
Sang's Saga, Chapter 1  There once was a Dot who was small in size, but mighty in wit and confidence!
Sang's Saga, Chapter 1  There was once a wily Peridot named Sang. Although they were smaller than their friends, their fast mind and courage more than made up for it.
{creatureName} practiced some striking poses while you were gone. They've almost perfected them!
{creatureName} jumped in all the puddles they could find while you were away. They like making a splash!
Do you want to hatch a new Peridot and raise the next generation? Your current Peridot will be released at this Habitat. You'll be able to hang with them again later.
Should {creatureName} lose interest in their desire?
Are you sure you want to remove {otherPlayerCodename} from your friends?
Are you sure you'd like to send {amount} {giftName} Nest parts?
Are you sure you'd like to send a {giftName}?
Are you sure you want to stop tracking {creatureName} with the Summoning Wisp?
{creatureName} is a cool name! You're pretty happy with it, right?
They want to do something with you!
Walk 1km to earn some Peridough. Use your reward from this desire in the Store! Turn on Adventure Sync to count the steps you take with your Peridot.
Show your Dot a tree trunk by viewing one through your device. Use your reward from this desire in the Store!
Kelp can be found by foraging in water. Once you find it, feed it to your Dot. Use your reward from this desire in the Store!
Show your Dot a flower by viewing one through your device! Use your reward from this desire in the Store!
Find a Dewdrop to earn some Peridough. It's rare, but you can find it by foraging across surfaces. Use your reward from this desire in the Store!
Once your Peridot account is deleted, it will no longer be accessible by you or anyone else. This action cannot be undone.
These are your current Peridot's desires. Complete them to help your Dot gain experience and grow, and eventually they’ll become mature enough to breed with other Peridots at Habitats.
Find some food for {creatureName} by foraging throughout the world.
Only use letters, numbers, and spaces.
Nice try, but your Peridot's name must: {error}
Looking for more Dotnip? Come back tomorrow!
Come back tomorrow for more Dotnip!
Complete the three listed desires to boost your Dot's mood and get that Dotnip fix! Dotnip has been known to make Dots very happy.
Your Dot doesn't have any desires right now
Complete your remaining Daily Dotnip desires
Trace a circle on the ground to see your Dot forage!
Email me events, offers, and updates
Muri's Saga, Chapter 1  A Dot set themselves the ultimate challenge: racing the sun!
Muri's Saga, Chapter 1  There was once a Dot who had big plans for each day, but they always ran out of daylight before they could do it all.
Muri's Saga, Chapter 1  The fabled Dot Muri was bursting with energy. Yet, try as they might, they could never get as much done in the day as they wanted before sunset!
{creatureName} raced some wild Dots to {poiName} and back while you were gone! Naturally, they won the race!
{creatureName} zoomed over to {poiName} while you were gone. And there. And back. And there. And back!
Error loading Peridot. Please try again later.
Error loading Peridot. Peridot may not be available in your region.
Whoops, we failed to breed your Dot. Awkward...
Campfire failed to open at this time. Please try again later!
You have to complete that desire for the gains!
Whoops, we failed to update the status of Adventure Sync. Please try again.
Looks like your creature didn't feel like eating at the moment. Please try again later!
Find a Spring Onion by foraging in the dirt. Once you find it, feed it to your Dot.
Find a Blue Tomato by foraging in some foliage, like bushes or tree leaves! Once you find it, feed it to your Dot.
Find a Dandelion by foraging in the grass. Once you find it, feed it to your Dot.
Prickly Beets can be found by foraging in the sand. Once you find it, feed it to your Dot.
Sandwiches can be found by foraging on tile, carpet, or other man-made surfaces. Once you find it, feed it to your Dot.
Kelp can be found by foraging in water. Once you find it, feed it to your Dot.
You're all out of toys! Forage with your Dot to find more.
Stand up, find a flat surface, and summon {creatureName} by double tapping
{creatureName} got their first desire! Let's check it out.
Login to enable Adventure Sync to count your steps!
Turn on Adventure Sync to count your steps!
No rewards this time. Get your walk on!
You walked {amount}km according to your previous weekly fitness report!
Foraged from dirt. This is a day old and will expire tomorrow.
Increases your Dot's happiness by a lot!
Foraged from foliage. This is a day old and will expire tomorrow.
Foraged from grass. This is a day old and will expire tomorrow.
Foraged from sand. This is a day old and will expire tomorrow.
Mutliply your Dot's experience gains! The effects of this last half an hour.
Foraged from any area, but rarely. Feed this to your Dot to reveal one of their traits.
Foraged from unnatural areas. This is a day old and will expire tomorrow.
Foraged from water. This is a day old and will expire tomorrow.
{creatureName} found a Spring Onion for you! They're still new to foraging, but they had a go while you were out.
{creatureName} found a Kelp for you! They're still new to foraging, but they had a go while you were out.
{creatureName} found a Dandelion for you! They're still new to foraging, but they had a go while you were out.
{creatureName} found a Prickly Beet for you! They're still new to foraging, but they had a go while you were out.
{creatureName} found a Blue Tomato for you! They're still new to foraging, but they had a go while you were out.
{creatureName} is looking at something! Complete the spectacle before foraging.
Try asking your Peridot to forage on different surfaces to find a bunch of different things.
You found some food in the world around you!
Player with friend code {otherPlayerFriendCode} doesn't exist
Are you sure you want to change your Friend Code? You'll no longer be able to receive Friend Requests with your current Friend Code. This change won't affect your current Friend List.
Sorry! We failed to change your Friend Code. Please try again later.
We failed to fetch info for your friends. Please try again later.
Your friend still has a gift in their inbox from you. Very generous of you though!
Invite already sent to player with code {otherPlayerFriendCode}
Sign in to connect with friends:
Check the YOU page to see their profile!
Destination player has a full request inbox
Failed to send a Friend Request to the player
Successfully sent a Friend Request to {otherPlayerCodename}
To enable Friends, please have a parent or guardian log into their Niantic Kids Parent Portal account and enable the Friends permission for your account.
Visit the map and look for Habitats! Now that your Peridot is an adult, you can use your Nests to breed a new Dot.
Forage at a Habitat to find Nest parts! Once your Peridot is an adult, you can use your Nests to breed a new Dot. Your Dot's family will be completely unique!
You and your Dot can find new foods and other items by drawing a circle on bushes, ground, trees, and even water.

Your Peridot is ready to explore the world! Visit a Habitat to see compatible Dots that live there. When you breed your Dot, you'll get a new generation of Peridot! You can alway hang with your previous Dot by using a Summoning Wisp.
Breed with another Peridot at a Habitat
Who doesn't love a good scratch? Try giving them a little scratch on their head with your finger.
Your Peridot is so curious about trees! You can also help them discover pets, people, and flowers too by pointing your device's camera toward the object.
We failed to get a referral code for you. Please try again later.
Your referral code cannot be refreshed right now. Please retry again later!
Your referral code has been updated.
You can't switch this Dot right now. Try again later.
Oh no, there was an error trying to fetch your Dotnip!
We couldn't grab your Friend Requests. Please try again later.
We're still working on your current GIF. Hold tight.
Gif is too large to upload to Campfire
Couldn't find the player you're trying to send a gift to. Spooky!
The destination player isn't on your friend list
You don't have enough of this item to send as a gift
Your gift outbox to this player is full
The player you tried to collect a gift from no longer exists
Couldn't find a gift with the supplied gift ID
Jin's Saga, Chapter 1  A group of Peridots were invited to a heavenly place.
Jin's Saga, Chapter 1  A long time ago, an emperor invited a group of special Dots to their palace.
Jin's Saga, Chapter 1  Once long ago, a legendary Dot and their nine children were invited to the palace of the emperor. They needed to be on their best behaviour.
{creatureName} chased their own shadow all the way to {poiName} while you were away. It followed them all the way home, too!
{creatureName} accidentally walked in some wet cement whilst you were gone. If you see some small footprints nearby, you know who they belong to!
No Nests, get one from the store
Looks like no account exists for the chosen login. We'll sign you back into your guest account so you can try a different login.
You're making history! Your {generation} of Peridot!
Choose wisely, this could be a very special Peridot. Which egg will it be?
{creatureName} is full and refuses to eat!
{creatureName} went on a journey while you were away. What have they been up to?
Petting your Peridot increases their happiness and gives them some experience!
Welcome back! {creatureName} went on journey while you were away and found a flower. Did you know {creatureName} can recognize flowers?
{creatureName} ran around in the flower fields while you were away.
{creatureName} foraged in the dirt while you were away and brought back a Spring Onion.
{creatureName} went on a journey and brought you back a Blue Tomato from the foliage.
{creatureName} wanted to surprise you. They foraged in the grass and brought you back a Dandelion!
{creatureName} foraged in the sand while you were away and brought back a Prickly Beet.
{creatureName} foraged in the water while you were away and brought back some Kelp.
{creatureName} went on a journey and met up with {otherCreatureName} while you were away. Add more friends for more chances to meet with other Peridots!
{creatureName} and {otherCreatureName} compared tails while you away. Add more friends to learn about new Archetypes and genes you haven't discovered!
{creatureName} visited {poiName} while you were away. It'd be great to take {creatureName} there and snap a picture!
{creatureName} went on a journey to visit {poiName} and noticed that there are other Peridots there!

Every hour when you come back to check on your Peridot there's a chance they'll have gone on a Journey! They may have gone to a Habitat, met some friends, or who knows what else! When your Peridot is a specific Archetype, there's a chance they'll bring back a Nest of that Archetype for you.
Congrats on finishing the tutorial! Now take this Speed Sprout and feed it to your Peridot! It'll increase their growth for the next 30 minutes.
To level up as a Keeper, discover new Archetypes and visit Habitats!
View the licenses for external libraries used in this project
Oh! It looks like a Niantic player already exists for that account. Please try a different one!
Sorry! We failed to get your Friend Code. Please try again later.
We couldn't log you in. Please try again!
Looks like no account exists for the chosen login. Please try another login.
You'll need to walk closer to this Habitat, it isn't in range
Do you think they are a good match?
Complete more desires to gain XP and raise {creatureName} to an adult first in order to breed.
{creatureName} and {otherCreatureName} floated up to the "{poiName}" Habitat, giving you an egg.
{creatureName} brought {otherCreatureName} a flower, and they ate it! Try again.
{creatureName} and {otherCreatureName} had a play fight! Try again.
{creatureName} and {otherCreatureName} caught some fireflies! Try again.
{creatureName} and {otherCreatureName} slept in a sunbeam together! Try again.
{creatureName} and {otherCreatureName} floated on a cloud! Try again.
{creatureName} let {otherCreatureName} sit in their favorite spot! Try again.
{creatureName} showed {otherCreatureName} an interesting flower! Try again.
{creatureName} gave {otherCreatureName} their favorite toy! Try again.
Come back later, {creatureName} is just a baby!
Come back later, {creatureName} is just a teen!
Look at that! {creatureName} is growing up, and all because you completed their desires. Once they reach adulthood, you can go to a Habitat and see what other Dots are there to breed with.
{creatureName} learned that they are {traitName}!  Your Peridot's traits help them match with other Peridots that hang out at Habitats.
You found a Nest part!  Nest parts are found by foraging when you are in range of a Habitat! Collect 5 Nest parts to craft a full Nest!
The food in your bag only lasts for so long!  Each day your food will age and will eventually be removed from your bag.
You can use Nests to try to breed with another Dot. Improve your odds of breeding by using more Nests! Afterwards {creatureName} will be released, and you'll be able to hang with them later on.
Your Journal is where you'll be able to see your Peridot's desires, age, and traits. You can even see your tracked Dots and all the Peridot Archetypes you've bred on your Dot page.
Nests are used to breed with other Peridots you’ll find at Habitats. Some Nests will influence the look of baby.
These are all the Dots other players have released at this Habitat.  Some Dots match better with others based on their traits. Reveal more of a Dot's personality for a better match!
When your Peridot is unhappy, they will refuse to forage. Walk them, pet them, feed them food or Dotnip, or visit Habitats to make them happy again.
If you remove a desire before it expires overnight, your Peridot will lose some happiness. If they become too unhappy, they might not do everything you ask them to.
Walking your Peridot gains them XP. Peridot needs access to your location in the background in order to count the steps you take with your Peridot.
Hip's Saga, Chapter 1  One Peridot spied another, and fell hard!
Hip's Saga, Chapter 1  There was once a fast-running Peridot. One day they spotted another Peridot, and instantly became smitten.
Hip's Saga, Chapter 1  There once lived a sweet, naive Peridot named Hip, who could run as fast as the wind. One day, they saw another Dot, Atta, and became smitten.
{creatureName} found an old candy wrapper near {poiName} while you were away. They tried to lick it! They were disappointed by what they found.
{creatureName} heard there was a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow. They took a look while you were away, but didn't find anything.
A new discovery is in the books! You just discovered the {achievementName} Archetype!
When your Dot has desires, fulfill them to help them grow!
You don't have any pending Friend Requests.
Add some friends to see their Dots and get 100% matching compatibility!
Your Dot will go on Journeys while you’re away. Come back later to see what they’ve been up to!
You don’t have any Nests. Forage at a Habitat or get some from the Store.
No tracked Dots or Summoning Wisps. Grab a Wisp from the store!
The Dots played together and had a nice time, increasing your chances of a match.
This is not a new player, skipping referral code flow...
Received new Friend Request from player {otherPlayerCodename}
Get ready to introduce {creatureName} to the world!
Kids - make sure you have proper parental supervision while using AR.
Make sure you’re in a safe location while using AR.
You'll surely want to keep them happy. Give them a little pet and watch their happiness meter go up!
Not enough Nests or shards to send!
Click below to download the latest.
Click below to go to Testflight to download the latest.
You already sent this player a gift! They haven't accepted it yet.
Please allow Camera permissions in your App Settings to continue playing.
Please allow Location permissions in your App Settings to continue playing.
Unknown error. Camera and Location permissions are granted.
{creatureName} is out of range! Double tap on nearby ground to summon them.
Give {creatureName} a little scratch on the head
Destination player has max friend count
You're {amount}m away from being in range
Your Peridot wants to check out a Habitat. When you get there you can forage for Nests, find a match for {creatureName}, or just take a fun photo of the adventure!
Your Peridot wants to check out a Habitat. Once you get there you can forage for Nests, find a match for {creatureName}, or take a fun photo to share with your friends!
Your Peridot wants to visit a Habitat! You can get a glimpse of the Peridot world there. The last time we could experience this was 10,000 years ago, before Peridots went into hibernation.
Please review the Niantic Privacy Policy for information about how we process personal data.
Are you sure you want to buy this item?
Send push notifications for events, offers, and updates
Forage for Nest parts at a Habitat
Your Dot didn't get a new desire because it already has a desire from that type of food!
Your Dot doesn't have any available desires right now!
Your Dot enjoyed the delicious snack but didn't get a desire.
Your Dot didn't get a desire because they're already at the max number of desires!
Your friend raised this Dot! (100% match chance)
Failed to redeem referral rewards. Please try again later.
Sorry! We failed to send a friend invite to the Keeper who referred you. You'll need to send an invite to them manually via the Add Friend feature.
We sent a friend invite to the player who referred you!
{creatureName} is still out on a journey!
Whoops, failed to reject that desire. You can remove the desire under your Dot's page.
Here's {amount} Peridough. Buy a treat for {creatureName}!
Continue completing desires to grow your Peridot!
Makes the baby a 24 Karat Archetype with gold colors and a metallic look.
Makes the baby a Banana Archetype with gold colors, a banana-y horn, no plumage, no horn, and a blotchy pattern.
Makes the baby a Bee Archetype with brown and yellow colors, stripes, and no tail.
Makes the baby a Cactus Archetype with green colors, a head plume in a bright color, a pattern, and spikey plumes.
Makes the baby a Celestial Archetype with celestial colors, a starry look, and a starry pattern.
Makes the baby a Clownfish Archetype with bright orange-y colors and a tropical pattern.
Makes the baby have dark colors.
Makes the baby gold and metallic.
Makes the baby have vaporwave colors.
Makes the baby have yellow colors.
Makes the baby have dark colors.
Makes the baby a Neon Archetype with neon colors.
Makes the baby have bright colors.
Makes the baby have pastel colors.
Makes the baby a Cotton Candy Archetype with pastel colors, fur, and a chonky body.
Makes the baby a Cow Archetype with black and white colors, a cow pattern, and long horns.
Makes the baby have no ears.
Makes the baby glittery and pastel.
Makes the baby have a narwhal horn.
Makes the baby have no horns.

{creatureName} is itching to get out and meet other Dots, and learn about themselves in the process! Forage at a Habitat to discover more about your Peridot's personality.  Discover more traits to boost your Peridot's compatibility with other Dots you come across at Habitats.
Discover a trait at a Habitat

Your Peridot ate a Dewdrop, which made them want to visit a Habitat and uncover a new personality trait! Forage there to complete this desire.  The more traits you uncover, the better chance your Dot will have to match with other Dots at Habitats!
Discover a trait at a Habitat
Forage at a Habitat to complete this desire and discover a new personality trait.  Feed your Dot another Dewdrop to unlock more about their personality!

{creatureName} is very scholarly! They wonder if you’ve read all the great classics.

{creatureName}, The Open Book. They’re the worst liar ever.

{creatureName} is a total wallflower. They have no one to dance with.

{creatureName} is wild! They're known for dancing on tables.
